title: [K-12] Axiomatic Design-Based Sociotechnical Instructional Design for Enhancing Maritime Safety and Crisis Response Competencies: Focused on Civic Rights and Community Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of maritime safety terminology, computer and internet literacy, foundational understanding of social collaboration and crisis management concepts, and basic awareness of civic rights and community systems
context.additional_context: Customized curriculum for systematically acquiring practical skills and social responsibility required in high-risk environments. Emphasizes citizen participation, community collaboration, and institutional support for preventing maritime accidents.

learning_goals: Learners analyze uncertainties in marine work environments using fuzzy set theory and develop crisis response strategies considering citizens’ safety rights within social networks.
Using axiomatic design methodology, learners derive systems for marine safety protocols that account for functional requirements, citizens’ safety rights, and community collaboration frameworks.

Through virtual simulations, learners perform decision-making processes during marine emergencies with ≥90% accuracy and propose response plans incorporating community collaboration and citizen participation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
